meanings.definition: Exposing (someone or something valued) to danger, harm, or loss.
meanings.sent1: She was risking her life by crossing the busy street without looking both ways.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter was risking his safety to save the trapped kitten from the burning building.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel was risking it all to reach the delicious acorns on the other side of the fence.
meanings.sent4: By swimming in the deep ocean alone, he was risking plunging into the unknown depths of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The reckless driver was risking a collision by speeding through the red light.

meanings.definition: Taking a chance on; putting at stake.
meanings.sent1: He was risking his savings by investing in the new startup company.
meanings.sent2: The gambler was risking his luck by placing all his chips on a single number.
meanings.sent3: The chef was risking his reputation by trying out a bold new recipe for the restaurant's menu.
meanings.sent4: By confessing his feelings to her, he was risking his heart in the game of love.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was risking his expedition's success by taking a shortcut through the treacherous jungle.
